intro: Paropsia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy paropsia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
